John is a software-engineer and has been working in the technology sector for over 15 years. He currently resides in Illinois. He has always been passionate about coding and has contributed to numerous projects, including a popular mobile app that streamlines project management for small businesses.

how can i assist you today
what is mitochondria

Mitochondria are tiny organelles found in the cells of most eukaryotic organisms, including animals, plants, and fungi, that generate energy for the cell through a process called cellular respiration.
more

Mitochondria are often referred to as the "powerhouses" of the cell because they produce most of the energy that the cell needs to function, through a process that involves the breakdown of glucose and other organic molecules.

Mitochondria are tiny organelles found in the cells of most eukaryotic organisms, including animals, plants, and fungi, that generate energy for the cell through a process called cellular respiration. Mitochondria are often referred to as the "powerhouses" of the cell because they produce most of the energy that the cell needs to function, through a process that involves the breakdown of glucose and other organic molecules. 



summarise
Mitochondria generate energy for cells through cellular respiration, producing most of the cell's energy through the breakdown of glucose and organic molecules.

Mitochondria are often referred to as the "powerhouses" of the cell because they produce most of the energy that the cell needs to function, through a process that involves the breakdown of glucose and other organic molecules.
shorten
Mitochondria produce most of a cell's energy.
